alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:22PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Carbon and western Albany Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 622 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles east of Seminoe Campground to 8 miles north of Encampment. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albany, Saratoga, Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Battle Mountain, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Nash Fork Campground, Ryan Park Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Arlington, French Creek Campground, Ryan Park, Brooklyn Lake, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground and Bow River Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 238 and 291. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
